website_summaries.verdict: The Reebok Forever Floatride Energy is an everyday training and running shoe that is perfect for any pace. Overall, the ideal combination of a breathable upper, a responsive midsole, and a durable and tractive outsole was accepted by many. There are some minor but observable downsides to this shoe, which include the shoelaces being too short and the slightly narrow tongue. Despite these issues, others still highly recommend the Reebok Forever Floatride Energy because of its quality and excellent performance.
pros: Some users appreciate the Reebok Forever Floatride Energy's adaptability to any running speed
According to some runners who tried the Forever Floatride Energy, the midsole gives a highly responsive energy return
One of the topmost advantages the shoe has is its simple design
Another famous remark from most of the runners is the excellent traction it provides during the activity
A vast majority of buyers have positive reactions to its breathable upper
Numerous consumers highly appreciate its affordable price
A good number of reviewers have commented that the shoe's outsole area is durable
cons: Most of the users have criticized the short length of the laces
One of the buyers discussed that the tongue is a bit narrow, which makes it slide a little bit
As a result, it gives a stiff feeling while running
One of the frequent observations is the collar being comparably higher than other running shoes which may come as a bit of an issue for some buyers

customer_reviews.title: Be careful with the insoles
customer_reviews.text: It is a great shoe but ruined by the ridiculous insole. If you grow blisters after wearing this shoe, you may wanna check the non removable insoles. My right insole is ridiculously glued together from two pieces, and the glue line is a little bit more stiff than around area, so it will slightly scratch my forefoot. It is hard to notice, but it definitely causes problems after long run. Why? Why do you do this, Reebok? You make great shoes but try to save money on the insoles. That's insane.
customer_reviews.author: SleepyHead

customer_reviews.title: Order a half size smaller, otherwise, everything about this shoe is great
customer_reviews.text: So far, online reviewers mention the great midsole, the lightness, and durability of this shoe, which are all correct. It's a great daily trainer, but I highly suggest ordering a half size smaller than usual, or if you're normally between one size and another, order the smaller size.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew P

customer_reviews.title: Underrated shoe...
customer_reviews.text: First off let me say this shoe is awesome. It’s a very comfortable light-weight and good-looking shoe. I absolutely love Reebok’s technology of the foam they used. It is feels right in the middle, not to soft not to hard. The shoe is advertised for $100 but feels more like a shoe that costs $150. It’s definitely an underrated shoe for this year. With that said, reading other reviews of this shoe it definitely runs 1/2 size bigger. I normally wear a size 13 but fit comfortably in a size 12.5. I would definitely recommend this shoe for someone that wants a good running shoe but doesn’t want to spend a lot of money.
customer_reviews.author: Chad B

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for the money
customer_reviews.text: Read the many mixed reviews of this shoe, from lacing problems, small to size and blisters from running. Experienced none of these. I'm aa 9.5 and always buy running shoes 1/2 size large. Worked good for this shoe. Surprised @ generous insole cushioning considering the ultra lightweight overall. Not a long distance runner any more. I run or walk 3-5 miles daily and this shoe has done great over last 30 days. Caught these on sale @ Amazon for $75. Note - color affects price. Considering shoes were $50 - $100 cheaper than competition, I am very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Please avoid; cheap and overpriced. Product will cause training injuries.
customer_reviews.text: At $100 this shoe is grossly overpriced. The material is flimsy and low-grade; like a pair of $30 off-brand sneakers at Walmart. The toe of the shoe tightens downward at a severe angle due to the poor lace design; this causes the shoe to be loose in the heel/ankle and uncomfortably tight around the toes. If you did not have training injuries before you ran in these shoes, you certainly will after.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Women’s size 8-8.5 fits men’s size 7 great
customer_reviews.text: I’m a female! I wear size 8 usually, sometimes size 8.5. I got these in men’s size 7. They fit fine, I do have maybe 1.5 cm left at the toe. But I don’t think the look too wide or long on me. They’re lightweight. Color is more like green then highlighter yellow like I was thinking they would be. But I love the colors! Only thing I don’t like (so far) is the white sole area. Looks like white styrofoam around the soles. It’s not. Oh well, hoping these are comfortable to wear. I’ll update my review as I wear them more :)!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: “Like running in marshmallows”
customer_reviews.text: Upon arrival, I thought these shoes must run very large because they didn’t look like a 7.5. However, when my son put them on, they were a perfect fit. After a 5 mile run, he said that it was “like running on marshmallows”. I’ll take that as a ringing endorsement from a 15 year old! All that to say, they’re apparently very comfortable - especially for distance running and the black and gold is very sharp looking!
customer_reviews.author: liz k

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value!
customer_reviews.text: Overall impressions are: terrific shoe and excellent value. Provides excellent cushioning for all types of workouts I tried so far, from tempo to speed to recovery. I agree with other reviews about the shoe being 1/2 size too big- order 1/2 size down; also, the heel is a bit high and first run it irritated my Achilles... but I wore different socks next time and zero bother. That’s the only reason for the 4-star rating. Once I dialed in the right size and socks, it’s a 5-star neutral ride that beats many higher priced competitors.
customer_reviews.author: NY shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great light running shoe
customer_reviews.text: I wore New Balance 990/993s for 15 years. As their price kept rising every year, I decided to try a different more affordably priced shoe. This Reebok was $100 versus $150 for the 993. It is much lighter than the 993 and other running shoes with a wicking type top that is more breathable in the hotter climate I live in. I run in the shoe often and also use them for yard work and other daily use. They have held up well to my abuse and are still comfortable to run in after 6 months of use.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob TX

customer_reviews.title: Could these shoes keep causing my ankle to roll?
customer_reviews.text: After about 40 miles of running in these shoes, I severely rolled my ankle for no apparent reason during a run on a smooth sidewalk. I took 3 weeks off running and went out for another run and literally made it 30 feet and the same thing! So painful. Waited a couple more weeks. Went for a run. Made it 1.6 miles and BAM! Same ankle. Smooth asphalt. Had to call for a ride. I'm terrified of these shoes. I'm going back to the New Balance I've been wearing for years. They seem to have wider sole at the heal. I'm bow legged but have never had these issues in all my years of running.
customer_reviews.author: David Hollowell

customer_reviews.title: For the money, best functional everyday trainer.
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly lightweight. My mens size 10.5 was about 9.4oz. The foam is pretty dense, but feels springy underfoot, and my legs feel fresh, even after long runs. I use these shoes for everything: Track work, long runs, tempo workouts. Like I said, great energy return for a non-plated shoe. Reebok is a sleeper in the running shoe category, but these no-frill trainers ride and fit similar to the nike pegasus (in my opinion). If you're between two sizes, definitely go a half-size down. They do seem a little long for the size.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Weiss

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding shoe, not for everyone
customer_reviews.text: This was one of the higher rated neutral shoes despite the price point. I prefer lower drop shoes because of my foot strike, and the cushioning does not disappoint without the added cushioning. They were instantly comfortable first time I wore them and I’ve not had any issues with the heel cup design. I’ve not run more than 10k yet, but will be in the coming weeks. They breathe well but were warm enough in cold weather runs. Outstanding value for these, Thank you Reebok. Didn’t think I’d own another pair ever.
customer_reviews.author: Javier R Alanis

customer_reviews.title: Order a little wider than normal
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad shoe, but if you plan to order this one make sure you order a wider size my were just a little tight
customer_reviews.author: Chief1

customer_reviews.title: Unwearable
customer_reviews.text: The back of the shoe rubbed my heel in a most painful manner. I wore them a few days with band-aids on my heels and double socks, but ultimately had to return them.
customer_reviews.author: Ms Snarkitect

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and stylish and reasonably priced
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are so comfortable. I read too order 1/2 size smaller, don't do it. The back of shoe near Achilles tendon us higher than most stores i wear caused me some pain after my first run. So I ended up exchanging for larger size and no more issues. Also these look really nice.
customer_reviews.author: Bordo

customer_reviews.title: Awesome cushion for running
customer_reviews.text: As a novice runner, this pair is perfect. They give comfortable support for my feet. And affordable!
customer_reviews.author: Setra Yappi

customer_reviews.title: Most beautiful running shoes I've had
customer_reviews.text: Compared to NB and other brands, this is one beautiful shoe. It's a good fit for natural/normal style runner. The shoes are light, airy and overall great. And honestly, they look stunning. You could wear them out outside of running as well. The only negative is the gold in the photo is not the same as the one on the real shoe. The gold on the shoe looks a bit cheaper/less shiny. Otherwise a really awesome shoe and I'm looking forward to my 300-400 miles using it.
customer_reviews.author: Suyog Mody

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe, Great Price
customer_reviews.text: I think I have found the “Goldielocks” shoe. These have proven to be a great daily training running shoe and would certainly perform very well in a race for me. They are a half size large so buy your regular dress shoe size. They have cushion without mush, support without a device, and great energy return. A great shoe at a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Greg Sinclair

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: Purchasing footwear online can prove to be a challenge, however, this purchase was spot on. The fit is perfect and the comfort is amazing compared to other sneakers that I've had in the past. I may even purchase another pair in a different color ;)
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: great buy
customer_reviews.text: great quality and light waight. 5 minuts after putting them on they became my favorite sneakers in my closet.
customer_reviews.author: yesiel delapaz

customer_reviews.title: Blisters
customer_reviews.text: Dug into back of heals causing blisters. Returned through Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Size runs about 1/2-size large
customer_reviews.text: A really good running shoe for a decent price. You can often find them on that pig-latin site (the one that translates to "Be") cheaper, but not with the same return policy...
customer_reviews.author: JMAG

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and very bright color
customer_reviews.text: The shoe is lightweight and fits well. Good for runs around the neighborhood.
customer_reviews.author: TPR

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Price Point for this caliber of shoe.
customer_reviews.text: I run 9-12 miles per week and cross train with weights and row machine. I am impressed with the cushion and no pronation. You can take long runs too. My only complaint is it rubbed my heel raw with socks on. I will work through this.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Boy

customer_reviews.title: Money's WORTH!
customer_reviews.text: I liked the reviews from Amazon and took the risk. I've used them for runs since I got them and they are very forgiving shoes. I'm not an expert runner but have run on mixed surfaces in them up to 10k and they were great. The shoelaces come undone, as others have said and that's the only hangup. That is a rarity, however.
customer_reviews.author: Spackling Compound

customer_reviews.title: 100% would recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe, ultra lightweight, super comfortable and perfectly adaptable. If you have a problem with them rubbing against your achilles tendon; just loosen them enough so your foot can move around a little bit inside the shoe until you break them in just quite enough. After a week or so, perfection.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Ok not great
customer_reviews.text: Is Reebok not just a weightlifting/CrossFit shoe brand and are they good enough to compete with the ASICS and Nike’s of the world? The answer I think is maybe. While the support is there, the heel is unforgiving and the cushion after 3 miles on asphalt started to give way to the point of shin pain. Hope Reebok corrects these issues!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Stanton

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and good price
customer_reviews.text: I use this shoe for normal intensity workouts in the gym. It is a well rounded, affordable option and good for every day use. Very comfortable as well; lightweight but with plenty of support at the heel and toe.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Harrington

customer_reviews.title: Comfortably functional and fashionable
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are a absolutely fantastic. I ordered the red/orange color variant and they are spot on with the image shown. There l these are great everyday running shoes. They are lightweight, comfortable, and breathable. And the red color is quite fashionable.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Zuniga

customer_reviews.title: Best quality but not good color
customer_reviews.text: I got this shoe for my friend's BD. The best thing he likes about it is its comfort and lightweight. However, It's colour was not that much interesting
customer_reviews.author: Pouneh

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and light
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a runner but I walk about 5 miles/week. I needed a pair of shoes that were comfortable and light. The Reebok Floatride Energy is perfect for my needs and gives me the best pair of shoes for the price.
customer_reviews.author: vb4491

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Testing out the Floatride model. It's comfortable with good cushion and absorption for road, dirt and field running.
customer_reviews.author: Aloysius

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic runners!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, I do not understand the few negative reviews. I have ran 60 miles in these now and they are fantastic running shoes. So much so I bought another pair (on sale from Reebok) for when they are done. They are cushioned, but not too much, very responsive and very smooth to run in. The only issue is sizing in that they are 0.5 size too large so order accordingly.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Packaging needs work
customer_reviews.text: Love the product will use for running. However packaging was excessive. Sneaker box was placed in a bigger box.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Value In Running Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I use this shoe as a near daily trainer. Comfortable cushioning, lightweight, and high end materials. If you are a "best bang for the buck" shopper, you won't be disappointed with the Reebok FFE.
customer_reviews.author: utapao67

customer_reviews.title: My favorite all around running shoe.
customer_reviews.text: I run about 30 miles a week. I need a shoe with about a 10mm drop from heel to forefoot. I just ordered my 3rd pair of these. They are easily one of my favorites. They are great for both long days and tempo runs. The foam holds up better than the uppers. My current pair are still soft but after about 500 miles the top is beginning to go. I won 50-59 year age group at Jalbreak Half Marathon in a pair in 2019.
customer_reviews.author: Josh R.

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe, go half size down
customer_reviews.text: Go a Half size down. Their sizing is weird and they run pretty long. Aside from that, these are great reocvery/long and easy running shoes. Super comfortable, imo softer than the New Balance Beacon if that's what you're looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Tj

customer_reviews.title: Found a new favorite Shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe and Great price been running in Adidas Boston and Adios shoes for last 7 years and I think these shoes are alot better! I've ran about 100 miles in them from 5k to a half marathon and the shoes felt great! Definitely recommend just order a half size smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Everley

customer_reviews.title: Upheel issue
customer_reviews.text: Just like the other reviewer mentioned, the upheel part is badly designed. It irritates my heel quite a bit. Otherwise, the shoes are great.
customer_reviews.author: CV

customer_reviews.title: Achilles tendon destroyer
customer_reviews.text: Like a knife in your Achille’s tendon, even when just walking.
customer_reviews.author: Djr311

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: excellent for walking and running. I was as expected 100% recommended
customer_reviews.author: Luis Johan De Leon

product_meta.title: Reebok Men's Forever Floatride Energy Running Shoe
product_meta.description: Cut out distractions for fast splits. These men's running shoes have a Floatride Energy Foam midsole for lightweight responsive cushioning from start to finish. A mesh upper provides support and ventilation so you can take each stride in comfort.
feature_bullets: Engineered mesh upper for breathability and support; Lightweight heel counter for locked-in heel stability
Floatride Energy Foam midsole for premium responsive cushioning; Medial midsole geometry engineered for neutral foot motion
Full carbon rubber outsole for smooth ride and durability
